groups.title: Dynamic Contrast Enhanced MRI of mouse Abdomen

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3461o","text":"This SOP includes a brief DCE protocol that consists of following major steps:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vmjt","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpfq","text":"1. Animal Preparation for tail vein catheterization","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap66o","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adlhm","text":"2. MRI calibration, acquisition of B1, T1 and DCE perfusion MRI","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7h4u9","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h9ed","text":"3. Animal recovery","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k1vf","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp808","text":"Note: The technical details for the acquisition of B1, T1 and DCE perfusion MRI can be found in the ISMRM 2022 abstract (Pickup S et al. “Abdominal DCE-MRI in mice with stack of stars sampling and KWIC image reconstruction”)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h292","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dh598","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3si84","text":"Animal should be transferred from the home cage to anesthesia box connected to isoflurane.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c83m8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk6c2","text":"1.1 Induction of general anesthesia ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f7gv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2proe","text":"1.Keep the animal under the isoflurane in an anesthesia box for sedation (Figure 1 (A)).    ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f9t61","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ajp9","text":"2. Connect the Mouse tail illuminator/restrainer nose cone (Braintree Scientific, Inc.) to the anesthesia tubing (Figure 1 (C)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"podj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2heq","text":"3. Animal should then be transferred to the Mouse tail illuminator/restrainer. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fbh4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tfro","text":"1.2 Preparing the animal for tail vein catheterization","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15vp9","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a69l","text":"1. Prepare a small needle (30 gauge) tubing connected to the catheter (PE10 - Polyethylene, Braintree Scientific) and insert it into lateral vein parallel to the tail (Figure 1 (B), (D)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50rfn","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6tn3","text":"2. Connect one side of the catheter to the syringe filled with PBS (Figure 1 (D)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ichr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5n219","text":"3. To verify proper injection slowly inject the PBS filled in the syringe. If there is resistance and/or a blister or white area appears above the needle on the tail, remove and reinsert again.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dduq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ssl","text":"4. Secure the needle using the tapes (Figure 1(D)). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"916l6","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d021h","text":"5. Remove the syringe and hup of the syringe and connect the catheter with an approx. 30 cm extended catheter to inject the contrast agent outside the magnet manually with a tape (Figure 2 (A), (B)).     ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":201,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7atro","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1o8i","text":"6. An FDA-approved contrast agent for clinical MRI, Prohance (Bracco diagnostic Inc., Germany) was diluted (50×) in PBS to 10 mmol/L gadolinium (Gd) for injection in mice. We refer this diluted contrast agent as gadolinium-based contrast agent (GBCA).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv7bc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hohq","text":"7. The extended catheter should be prefilled with GBCA. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2drq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f86lc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hr90","text":"1.3 Place the mice in with the vital signs monitoring","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k3ob","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acn1c","text":"1. Place the sedated animal on the animal bed and secure it properly with tape, secure the pneumatic pillow under the thorax of the animal to record proper breathing (Figure 2 (B)). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q8fa","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt2qh","text":"2. Insert the temperature rectal probe into the animal rectal using a lubricant for monitoring the temperature (Figure 2 (B)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35h6q","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crt1n","text":"3. Position the animal bed in the coil in a position which exposes the tumor-bearing region in the center of the magnet by measuring from the center line printed on the top of the coil (Figure 2 (C)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52j9u","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1guc1","text":"4. Now place the RF coil in center of the magnet using a non-metal yardstick and connect the temperature probe and respiration probe to the ERT module.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6td4q","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r5c9","text":"Note: Remember to always continue monitoring the animal vitals when it is on the scanner (Figure 2 (D)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":104},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mreq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q04d","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dn7fp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ve86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jvcn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ma04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jbig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce2gj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"486570F07CC211EC89033BEB1094E5D8","height":353,"id":254476,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure 1.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2sqbni97.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2snbni97.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2spbni97.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2smbni97.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B5C519407D3311ECA07AA9657C6C5192","height":326,"id":254481,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure {"blocks":[{"key":"9gp7u","text":"MRI Scanner Calibration, Scout, T2W MRI and DCE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ncnn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6llue","text":"Open ParaVision 6.0.1 for generating a new study. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q1b","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc6qg","text":"2.1. Localizer initiation","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anmfi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuvtv","text":"1. After generating a new study, a localizer can be selected from the scan programs and protocols drop down menu.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aht74","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"496hm","text":"2. For initiating a localizer, locate the appropriate protocol in the scanner interface/software.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ampgp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5diah","text":"3. Generally, a simple short T1-weighted image with a single slice in each orthogonal direction can provide enough spatial information to ensure that the animal is properly placed underneath the coil (Figure 3 (Panel (A)).  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":222,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2eg9g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvob1","text":"4. Prior to initiating the scan, a series of calibration/shimming is performed automatically by the scanner including the following steps: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2892v","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tqva","text":"I. Wobble -tuning and matching of the RF coil.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3ok3","text":"ii. Set the basic frequency","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s4g6","text":"iii. Perform auto shimming","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq1gu","text":"iv. Set the reference power","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gsi7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3anjp","text":"2.2 Select T2_Turbo with RARE technique (Tumor staging and reference image for DCE)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":83}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tav8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daeh7","text":"1. Select T2_Turbo with RARE technique (FOV=30x30, Slice thickness=1.00 mm, no. of averages=8) to obtain the coronal images.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tvj1","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b272k","text":"2. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmh2d","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acfmr","text":"3. Duplicate the first scan and increase the number of slices to cover the entire tumor with (number of averages=12) in axial direction for calculating the tumor size. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65pjn","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df509","text":"4. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j4mp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuve5","text":"5.The third scan T2_Turbo with RARE technique in axial plane can be set using the images obtained from the first scan. The T2_Turbo with RARE technique scan will serve as reference scan for the DCE. A preset FOV, NA, Slice thickness (1.5 mm), number of slices (16) were used according to the protocol (Figure 3 (Panel (B)). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a296t","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99d7n","text":"6. Turn on Autoshim then Mapshim and tick the automatic shim volume.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ofls","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75lhg","text":"7. In this study under geometry the read offset and phase offset were kept as zero. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agp7l","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eohj","text":"8. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l6bm","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ns87","text":"9. Before running the third scan the Bo inhomogeneity map can be obtained.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4htjv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5qms","text":"2.3 Acquire B1 map with outer volume suppression (OVS)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dkep","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aktb4","text":"1. Under application tab choose perfusion and then the custom developed radial K-space stack of star sampling (SPSOS 3d AF02) with OVS to acquire the B1 map.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jafp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h3sk","text":"2. Copy the T2_Turbo with RARE technique in axial plane sequence parameter to SPSOS 3d AF02 sequence from the drop-down menu.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gbc0","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ffos","text":"3. To set the OVS following steps can be done:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vri7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19gqd","text":"i.  Tick the FOV saturation under contrast. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ciqfv","text":"ii. There should be at least 1 slice gap between the acquisition slice and saturation slice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ogv","text":"iii. Set the thickness fraction to 0.85. Check the geometry again and then click on apply to start the sequence.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4dop","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rd4h","text":"4. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doo5f","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du16c","text":"2.4 Acquire T1 map with OVS using variable flip angle method","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"227s8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"na7d","text":"1. Under application tab choose perfusion and then the custom developed SPSOS3d01_ T1 with OVS to acquire the T1 map. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc7mp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fdvc","text":"2. Copy the T2_Turbo with RARE technique in axial plane sequence parameter to SPSOS3d01_ T1 with OVS sequence from the drop-down menu.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkdf","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cje6p","text":"3. To set the T1 with variable flip angle following steps can be done:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmrdg","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl2bi","text":"i.  Right click SPSOS3d01_ T1 with OVS sequence and multiply the instruction.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oj1j","text":"ii. Click on the hand icon and choose ExcPulse1 and then Flip angle. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l1e8","text":"iii. Set the Flip angles to 5, 8, 12, 16, 20.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhtbs","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"208kd","text":"4. Check all the SPSOS3d01_ T1 with OVS for all the flip angles and geometry.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fidg4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72qj7","text":"5. Click on apply to run the scans.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nve2","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2flc3","text":"2.5 Acquire the DCE series","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"105rf","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"boe7c","text":"1. Under application tab choose perfusion and then the custom developed golden angle stack of stars sampling (SPSOS3d01_ DCE) to acquire the perfusion maps. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agc75","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fmmf","text":"2. Copy the T2_Turbo with RARE technique in axial plane sequence parameter to SPSOS3d01_ DCE from the drop-down menu.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83vvk","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41f09","text":"3. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvk25","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epa95","text":"4. After 2 mins of baseline scan inject 200ul of GBCA manually in 10 secs to acquire the post contrast perfusion maps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gi4a","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg4cb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A98FE1E077F311ECB8C2E9D8191AA768","height":309,"id":254485,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure 3.JPG","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2szbni97.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2sxbni97.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2sybni97.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/h2swbni97.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acvso","text":"Remove and Recover Mice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64caj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tals","text":"1. Upon completing the scan, the RF coil/animal bed assembly are removed from the scanner.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctoiq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4al4r","text":"2. Vital sign probes and tail vein catheter are removed from the mice before anesthesia is turned off. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ph8c","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd8rf","text":"3. The mice should be recovered from the anesthesia by keeping it warm either using the warm pads or preheated operation table warmed at 37°C. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dca2t","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cdp7","text":"4. After the mice is recovered well it can be returned to its home cage.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
